'https://cargraze.com/blog/2025-mahindra-xuv-3xo-specs-design-performance-and-safety', 'content': '2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety  | Cargraze Home Cars Car Blog Tools Loan EMI Calculator Mileage Calculator Sell Used Car Check RC Login/ Register Home Car Info 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety Published On Dec 24, 2024 By Cargraze for Car Info A Comprehensive Review of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in 2025: Features, Performance, and Value Are you looking for a compact yet powerful vehicle that combines performance, safety, and value in one stunning package? The Mahindra XUV 3XO might be the car youre searching for! Lets dive into a detailed review to see what this model brings in 2025. Design and Exterior Highlights One look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO, especially in black, and its clear that this car is a head-turner. Its sporty design elements stand out with: Chrome Accents: The grille and headlamp finish feature stylish chrome highlights. Projector Headlamps with LED DRLs: These enhance visibility and aesthetics. Diamond-Cut Alloy Wheels: The 16-inch alloys add a premium feel to the vehicle. Safety Ratings: With six airbags and a five-star Global NCAP safety rating, this vehicle excels in safety. Roof Rails & Spoilers: Gloss-black roof rails and a sleek spoiler give it a bold presence on the road. Although the car lacks front parking sensors and certain accessories come as add-ons, its robust styling and road presence more than makes up for these minor drawbacks. Interior Comfort and Technology Step inside the Mahindra XUV 3XO, and youll be greeted by a modern and comfortable cabin: Dual-Tone Dashboard: Soft-touch materials on the doors and satin finishes on the levers add a premium touch. Advanced Infotainment System: A 10.25-inch infotainment display paired with a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster ensures seamless access to information and entertainment. Steering Controls: A three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel includes controls for cruise and infotainment systems. Comfort Features: From automatic climate control with dual-zone functionality to wireless charging and a vanity mirror with illumination, convenience is a priority. While its disappointing that the glovebox isnt cooled or illuminated, the XUV 3XO compensates with thoughtful features like rear AC vents, adjustable headrests, and ample storage options. Performance and Engine Specifications Under the hood, the Mahindra XUV 3XO packs a punch with its turbocharged petrol engine: Engine Options: It comes with a 1.2-liter three-cylinder MPFI engine, delivering 109 BHP and 200 Nm of torque. Transmission: Choose between manual and automatic transmissions, depending on your driving preference. Fuel Efficiency: Mahindra claims an ARAI-certified mileage of 18.5 km/l, though real-world figures hover around 14-15 km/l. The cars ride quality, stability, and safety features like ABS with EBD, electronic stability control, and tyre pressure monitoring ensure a secure driving experience. Practicality and Storage With a 364-liter boot space, the XUV 3XO offers decent storage capacity. However, operating the boot can feel a bit cumbersome due to its electromagnetic button placement. The spare wheel, tool kit, and first-aid essentials are neatly arranged but require some effort to access. Final Thoughts The Mahindra XUV 3XO is an impressive contender in the compact SUV segment. While it has its minor quirks, the blend of safety, design, and performance makes it a strong value-for-money option in its price range. Would we recommend it? Absolutely! Add it to your shortlist and take it for a spin to see if its the perfect fit for your needs. Dont forget to share your thoughts on this versatile vehicle in the comments section! Login OTP has been sent to Resend OTP Submit OTP Select City We need your city to customize your experience Select City V3Cars Reviews Mahindra XUV 3XO Engine Specifications, Mileage, Power, Torque Mahindra XUV 3XO Engine Specifications, Mileage, Power, Torque May 1, 2024, 11:58 AM IST By Prathu Sharma 0 This article will give you a perspective of the engine specs like, displacement, power, torque, mileage and transmission details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol and diesel engines. Considering the body style, size and price range of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it competes with the following cars: Kia Sonet Maruti Suzuki Fronx Renault Kiger NIssan Magnite Hyundai Venue Tata Nexon What Are The Engine Specs Of Mahindra XUV 3XO? MAHINDRA XUV 3XO | ENGINE SPECS Engine 1.2L Turbo Petrol 1.5L Turbo Diesel Displacement 1197cc 1197cc 1497cc Cylinder 3 3 4 Power 110PS @ 5000rpm 130PS @ 5000rpm 117PS @ 3750rpm Torque 200Nm @ 1500 - 3750rpm 230Nm @ 1500 - 3750rpm 300Nm @ 1500 - 2500rpm Manual 6-speed MT 6-speed MT 6-speed MT Automatic 6-speed TC 6-speed TC 6-speed AMT The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with 3 engine options: two 1.2L turbo petrol engines and a 1.5L turbo diesel engine. One of the 1.2L turbo petrol engine makes 110PS of power at 5000rpm and 200Nm of torque between 1500 and 3750rpm. This engine is available with a 6-speed MT and a 6-speed TC automatic transmission. The other 1.2L turbo petrol engine makes 130PS of power at 5000rpm and 230Nm of torque between 1500 and 3750rpm. This engine is also available with a 6-speed MT and a 6-speed TC automatic transmission. The 1.5L turbo diesel engine churns out 117PS of power at 3750rpm and 300Nm of torque between 1500 and 2500rpm. The 1.5L turbo diesel engine gets a 6-speed MT and a 6-speed AMT automatic transmission. What Is The Mileage Or Fuel Efficiency Of Mahindra XUV 3XO? MAHINDRA XUV 3XO | MILEAGE OR FUEL EFFICIENCY Engine 1.2L Turbo Petrol 1.2L Turbo Petrol 1.5L Turbo Diesel Manual FE 20.10kmpl 18.89kmpl 20.60kmpl Automatic FE 18.20kmpl 17.96kmpl 21.20kmpl The Mahindra XUV 3XOs lower tuned 1.2L turbo petrol engine has a mileage of 20.10kmpl with the 6-speed MT and 18.20kmpl with the 6-speed TC automatic transmission. The other 1.2L turbo petrol engine has a claimed mileage of 18.89kmpl with the manual transmission and 17.96kmpl with the TC automatic transmission. The 1.5L turbo diesel engine has a mileage of 20.60kmpl with the 6-speed MT and 21.20kmpl with the 6-speed AMT transmission. RTR 310 RE Bullet 350 Honda CB200X Follow us Cars Bikes news reviews compare Type vehicle name.. go Home News Mahindra XUV 3XO TGDI AT real world mileage and performance figures revealed Gajanan Kashikar Updated: May 10, 2024, 05:37 PM IST Mahindra recently launched the new XUV 3XO with prices starting from Rs 7.49 lakh (ex-showroom). It is available in a range of variants, namely MX1 Pro, MX2 Pro, MX3, AX5, AX5L, AX7, and AX7L. We recently tested the updated XUV 3XO to get the real-world performance and mileage figures, read on to find out the details. Mahindra XUV 3XO: Powertrain While the XUV 3XO carries over the same 110PS/200Nm 1.2-litre turbo-petrol, a 130PS/230Nm 1.2-litre T-GDI turbo-petrol, and a 117PS/300Nm 1.5-litre diesel engine, there is a new six-speed torque converter automatic transmission on offer alongside a six-speed manual and a six-speed AMT. In our performance test, the 1.2-litre TGDI petrol with six-speed automatic transmission returned a mileage of 12.49kmpl in the city and 14.87kmpl on the highway. In contrast, the overall ARAI fuel economy of this powertrain stands at 18.20kmpl. Further, the 1.2-litre turbocharged petrol paired with the six-speed torque convertor enabled the XUV 3XO to achieve zero to 100kmph in 10.7 seconds. In terms of in-gear acceleration, the SUV was able to reach from 30kmph to 50kmph in 2.0 seconds, 50kmph to 70kmph in 2.3 seconds, and 60kmph to 80kmph in 2.8 seconds. In addition, a braking test was conducted, revealing that the XUV 3XO required 3.7 seconds to come to a complete stop from a speed of 100kmph, covering a distance of 46m. 18.40 Lakh On road price, Delhi Delhi Starting 13,193 /month EMI calculator Get EMI offers Enquire now Mahindra XUV 3XO highlights The XUV 3XO gets two petrol and one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. Feature and power packed compact SUV Mahindra XUV 3XO review - Feature and power packed compact SUV Out goes the Mahindra XUV300 and in comes the XUV 3XO. The new name is just the starting point of a very comprehensive upgrade. Updated on May 02, 2024 05:35:55 PM 87,030 Views Follow us on The XUV 3XO's styling is big on flash The diamond-shaped detailing on the lights and grille are a nice touch. The infotainment is now a 10.25-inch unit and works well. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. Mahindra XUV 3XO Price, Mileage, Specifications, Features and Variants Brand Mahindra Model Name XUV 3XO Mahindra XUV 3XO Price 9.06 - 18.39 lakh Mahindra XUV 3XO Range/Mileage Petrol : 17.96 - 20.1kpl | Diesel : 20.6 - 21.2kpl Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications SUV | 5 doors | 5 seats View All Specs Mahindra XUV 3XO Features LED headlight | 10.25-inch Touchscreen display | 6 airbags View All Features Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants MX1 1.2 Petrol MT | REVX M 1.2 Petrol MT | REVX M (O) 1.2 Petrol MT View All Variants In its basic shape though, the 3XO is no different than the XUV300. The 2,600mm wheelbase remains class best, but the short overhangs, particularly at the back, tell you that this is a vehicle that's brutally shortened (remember it started life as a SsangYong Tivoli) to get length under the critical 4m mark, needed to qualify as a small car and hence a lower rate of tax. New 17-inch alloys are the largest in the segment.
